job_title: Patient Service Representative in Salinas, CA
pros: With a 30 minute lunch, nice to have options in the cafeteria. I also met a good friend in my department. Benefits are okay, considering YIU are a County Employee.
cons: Kind of like being in grade school with your supervisor breathing down your neck and micromanagement is their specialty. You may be entitled to a annual wage increase but if you get a raise, at the most you will receive .50¢ you can also plan on staying in your same position forever until someone retires or dies. No potential for advancement.

review_title: Crappy, dysfunctional IT department. Revolving door of consultants and poor pay
job_title: Systems Programmer Analyst in Salinas, CA
pros: The only good reason to work here is that it's close to the Monterey area, and the work life balance is OK.
cons: Poor pay (no bonuses), bottom of the barrel IT work, no respect, disparate job duties (actually, really disparate job duties), no clear focus, no cool factor.  Hospital IT is not cool or respectable in the IT world like working at the giant techs or start ups.  And, it can be a stressful gig since they're always pulling their analysts in all sorts of directions.
